title: Cowleaze Chine
text:
Cowleaze Chine is a geological feature on the south west coast of the <a href="Isle%20of%20Wight">Isle of Wight</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. It lies to the west of the village of <a href="Little%20Atherfield">Little Atherfield</a>.
This <a href="chine">chine</a> is just to the west of the larger Shepherd's Chine. It starts just off the side of the <a href="A3055%20road%23Military%20Road">A3055 Military Road</a> and runs south west for about 250m to reach the beach at <a href="Brighstone%20Bay">Brighstone Bay</a> just to the north of <a href="Atherfield%20Point">Atherfield Point</a>. 
This chine's vegetation is a mixture of hardy bushes, scrub and rough grasses. At the widest part of the chine erosion and layers of grey
sediment are visible.
The Chine drains water from the mainly flat agricultural land to its north. The resulting stream reaches the coast at the top of a small cliff and falls the remaining 5m to the beach below where it soaks into the <a href="pebble">pebble</a>s and disappears. Originally the Chine would have been fed by the flow of water that now supplies neighbouring <a href="Shepherd%27s%20Chine">Shepherd's Chine</a>. 
To the east of Cowleaze Chine is the Atherfield Bay Holiday Centre consisting of a <a href="campsite">campsite</a> and chalets. 
The <a href="Isle%20of%20Wight%20Coastal%20Path">Isle of Wight Coastal Path</a> crosses Cowleaze Chine near the campsite.
